alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 08 at 3:32AM MST until March 10 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches possible. * WHERE...Northern Nebraska Panhandle...Converse County Lower elevations... Niobrara County in east central Wyoming. Especially the Pine Ridge from Dawes County... west into southeast Niobrara County. Includes Lusk... Harrison... Douglas... Crawford and Chadron. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions possible due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; Niobrara County
